summary: This bill, the "SANCTIONS in the West Bank Act," codifies Executive Order 14115, which imposes sanctions on individuals undermining peace and stability in the West Bank. It reinstates sanctions revoked by Executive Order 14148. The bill grants the President the power to terminate sanctions if the individual ceases the problematic activity and provides assurances against future violations, with notification to relevant congressional committees. It defines the 'appropriate congressional committees' involved in oversight.
